name: Transport capacity
functionStatement: Balanced sediment supply and transport preserves bed elevations, substrate sizes, spawning/benthic habitats, and supports riparian succession.
descriptionMarkdown: Flow/slope balance incoming sediment, avoiding major bars or deep scour, unless imbalance is historically normal.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Screen stream power using discharge and slope and compare with observed bars or scour. Detailed transport modeling is beyond screening.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: No major bar buildup or scour. Sediment load appears balanced for channel type.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Slight mismatch with minor deposition or scour.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Noticeable over or under capacity in channel sections.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Widespread bar formation or deep scouring indicating severe imbalance.
